page.title: 03Compton Village Stores p. 1
page.content: The owner of the shop is Mr. John Mason. The shop after was built after the Second World War, in about 1950. He has owned the shop since 1976. Mr Mason's shop is busiest between 7 a.m 8 a.m and 3.30 to 5'o clock p.m. The customers come from the Downs, Grove Road, the school and the village. Mr.Mason intends to retire in 1991 when he is 65 years old. The most popular items in the shop are newspapers. The most popluar paper sold is the 'Daily Telegraph.' Mr. Mason delivers papers over Compton Down as far as Grove Road and of course the village. Mr. Mason has people to help him to deliver the newspapers.
